IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: Care of elderly Jewish Community through residential and nursing home facility.
IRS990.MissionDesc: To promote the health and welfare of the community through the operation of a senior residential and nursing home facility. to provide outreach services and related health care and non-health care services to the elderly jewish community.
IRS990.Desc: The Reutlinger Community provides skilled nursing care and assisted living services to a maximum of 180 residents. Our skilled nursing capacity is 60. Our assisted living capacity is 120.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Part II-B, Line 1i - Other Activities Description
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Reutlinger Community pays dues to the California Association of Health Care Facilities, 25% of which are allocable to lobbying expenses.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Part III, Line 1a: If organization elected under SFAS 116 to not report are, historical treasures, o
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Community operates a Judaica museum ("Museum"). The Museum's collection consists of art objects that are held for educational and curatorial purposes. Each of the items is cataloged and preserved. Activities to verify the existence of the items and to assess the condition of each item are performed continuously. In accordance with the recommendations of the Property, Plant, and Equipment Topic of the FASB Accounting Standards Codification (FASB ASC 958-360), the Community has elected to exclude the value of the Museum's collection from the statement of financial position and gifts in kind are not recognized in the statement of activities. Purchase of art objects for the permanent collection are recorded as decreases in unrestricted net assets in the statement of activities. to date, the Community has not made any purchases of art objects for the museum.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Part III, Line 4: Description of organization's collections and how it furthers its purpose.
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: the Community operates a judaica museum which has a collection of various art objects that are held for educational and curatorial purposes to bring the community together and enrich the lives of jewish elderly and others in the community.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Part IV, Line 1b: Why is organization an agent, trustee, custodian or other intermediary for contrib
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The organization holds resident funds in trust accounts on behalf of its residents.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Part V, Line 4: Intended uses of the endowment fund.
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The endowment fund is used for the benevolence of residents who have exhausted their financial resources.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Part XI, Line 4b: Other revenue amounts included on 990 but not included in F/S
Part XII, Line 4b: Other revenue amounts included on 990 but not included in F/S
Form 990, Part VI, Line 11b: Form 990 Review Process
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The form 990 is reviewed by the audit committee, the President/CEO, and the CFO/Treasurer.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 12c: Explanation of Monitoring and Enforcement of Conflicts
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: each interested person within the organization must disclose the existence of the financial interest or conflict of interest and be given the opportunity to disclose all material facts to the directors and members of committees with governing board delegated powers considering the proposed transaction or arrangement. All conflicts of interest are periodically reviewed by the board.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 15a: Compensation Review & Approval Process - CEO, Top Management
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The performance of the organization's top management is reviewed annually. Any consideration of modification of management's compensation is determined by the President/CEO. Contributing factors for resolution of top management's compensation include historical performance of the manager, historical performance of the organization, comparison of managers in similar roles within the area, trends and direction for organizational stall, manager seniority, and competitive influences outside of the organization. The President/CEO's compensation is determined by the voting members of the Board of Directors.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 19: Other Organization Documents Publicly Available
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The documents are available upon request at the organization's place of business.
